reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband had out-patient knee surgery and we had (wisely) decided to stay the night rather than chance a 2.5 hr. car ride home afterwards. Upon checkin, the front desk attendant took care of providing a wheel chair and placed us in a spacious handicap room. I was very appreciative of the valet service and his help up to the room. We were very pleased with the decor and comfort of this beautiful and historic hotel. The view from our room of the palm trees dividing Almanden Street was beautiful!
reviews.title: Excellent experience...great service and value

likes.liked: — Service from front desk and valet (also price)

reviews.text: ... to expensive. I paid 230 USD + tax and for that money I would expect more value. Nice and clean hotel but nothing special - no charm and no breakfast included.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in downtown but....

reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel De Anza and were quite happy with our stay. The hotel staff was absolutely terrific. The public rooms in the hotel are great - tons of character. Our room, while a bit small compared with modern hotel rooms, was quite comfortable. The furniture was showing a bit of age, but was all in good condition. The bed was comfortable and the bed linens were very nice. I appreciate the triple sheeting - makes for a much nicer sleep. Breakfast was good - nice selection of pastries, breads and fruit. The standard eggs, bacon, potatoes, and oatmeal were also availible. The breakfast room has terrific high ceilings with painted beams. Such a nice way to start the day.
reviews.title: Great older hotel
Charming Hotel
reviews.text: I only have 2 complaints about the hotel. One is the ventilation - the heater/AC unit in our room was kind of loud and without it on the room was stuffy. The other complaint is the Raid Our Pantry - this seems to be sort of hit and miss. We returned about midnight and found pretty slim pickings in the pantry - a few slices of cold cuts and cheese, a little bit of fruit, and a few cookies. There was plenty of coffee and tea, but I had to search through the tea bags to find one without caffiene - it was midnight afterall. I think I got the one and only caffiene-free bag in the basket.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but too much noise
reviews.text: Others have complained about the noise from the planes. We were on the 9th floor, which is 2nd from the top, and were not bothered by the noise. The airport has a curfew, so late night noise wouldn't be a problem anyway, but we didn't hear a lot of noise in the morning either.

We stayed one night at the Hotel De Anza in San Jose. This hotel was the site of a wedding we attended. The hotel is beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable and clean. Our room had two double beds and tons of space to spread out. There is an armoire with a tv and a desk. The bathroom was huge and had high quality Aveda bath products that were appreciated. At night they have a "raid our pantry" feature where you can go and fix sandwiches and get some snacks - all complimentary. The breakfast is one of the best continental breakfasts I have had in a while. The breakfast is in a dining room and offers cereals, pastry, scones, breads, hot oatmeal, granola, fruit, coffee, & juice. After you eat, staff bring a bill where you write your name and hotel number. That way you won't be charged for the meal. You can order hot food as well, at a charge. The complimentary evening snacks and breakfast help with the high price of the rooms.
reviews.title: Hotel De Anza - Pleasant Hotel in San Jose

likes.disliked: — High priced rooms and charge for parking

reviews.text: Parking: Valet parking is $20. Across the street from the hotel is metered parking. We arrived on a Sunday and were able to park here for free. We put money into the meter at 9 AM Monday when they begin charging to park here.
reviews.title: Skip This Hotel!
Great quick getaway!
reviews.text: Negatives: The bathroom mirror is a bit high up and felt like we needed to step on our tip toes to see well. The lighted make up mirror on the wall was also high up (our group averaged 5'4" tall). The outside of the hotel has a painting of a woman diving into water so you would expect a pool or hot tub in this hotel. There are no such facilities.

Bottom Line: If you attend a wedding at this hotel, it is great to stay here just for the convenience. If money is not an issue, this hotel is a comfortable place to stay with a high end feel. Looking for a bargain? Shop around San Jose for a lower priced hotel.
reviews.title: Don't waste your time...Terrible hotel, terrible service

likes.disliked: — The room accommodations and the attititude of the staff

reviews.text: downtown san jose is not too big, but when it comes to hotel choices, there are many to choose from. you've got at least 5 other major hotel brands to choose from besides this one.
reviews.title: I will go back if I am in San Jose

reviews.text: I have such mixed reactions to my recent stay at the De Anza. The room was large, clean, with nice deco furniture. But...the air conditioning made horrible noises which I think can be fixed, and the bathroom ceiling vent creaked so badly that it prevented sleep. At least we could close the bathroom door. My goal in writing this review is my hope that the hotel managment will read these reviews and make some repairs. But then, except for the manager and assistant manager, the desk staff was not knowledgeable or efficient. But the price was right and I'll probably stay there again.
reviews.title: management needs to read this

reviews.text: Nice, charming historic building, but not without the problems of an old structure: flickering lights, unreliable plumbing/ water pressure, etc.... sometimes when I was in the shower, the water would just stop for several seconds at a time!
reviews.title: So-so in San Jo
Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The fitness fitness center and its facilities are poor, at best.

reviews.title: would stay here again
reviews.text: As for the service, they try- but they seem to have their share of problems. If you use the valet parking, be sure to call for your car at least 1/2 hour ahead (even though they claim it will only take 10 minutes).

reviews.title: Downtown San Jose Gem
reviews.text: All in all, a nice hotel if you're just spending a night or two for leisure travel... definitely would not recommend it for the business traveller.

The hotel has charm and character. There is an Art Deco flair to the decor. The bathroom had nice green tile, marble, and a big white tub. The window was large and looked down the avenue with a ncie view. However, the room was noisy due to air planes and sirens. It quieted down by 10 pm, so it wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: A hotel with character but a bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness room has a treadmill, an elliptical, a bike and a smith machine.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had an omlette delivered by room service. It was good.
reviews.title: Convenient but noisy

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel unless you are very sensitive to noise.
reviews.title: A delightful spot

likes.liked: — Mmmm, cookies! Really nice staff. Lovely views, comfy room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a weekend in San Jose and made arrangements to try the Hotel De Anza after reading reviews here.
reviews.title: Charm of an old Hotel with Perks of a New Resort
